channel.title: Inheritance on Brain Baking

item.title: inheritance
item.author: wouter.groeneveld@gmail.com (Wouter Groeneveld)
item.description: Javascript Inheritance JavaScript uses prototypal inheritance. This means that Javascript does not distinguish between classes/prototypes and instances and, therefore, we can add our desired behavior directly to the instance. “new” operator Zie http://unitstep.net/blog/2008/01/24/javascript-and-inheritance/ Gegeven de volgende functie: function X(bla) { this.x = bla; console.log("doeiets"); this.ding = function() { return this.x; }; } Wat gebeurt er bij de klassieke manier van een “klasse” initialiseren? Zo: new X("argument").
